sen.j: 三和土（たたき）は、叩き土に石灰や水を混ぜて練ったものを塗り、叩き固めて仕上げた土間。
sen.e: Tataki is an earthen floor which is made by mixing "tatakitsuchi" (beaten clod) with lime or water, beating and solidifying it.
Tataki is an earthen floor which is made by mixing "tatakitsuchi" (beaten earth) with lime or water, then beating and solidifying it.
Tataki is an earthen floor which is made by mixing "tatakitsuchi" (beaten earth) with lime and water, then beating and solidifying it.
sen.cmt: 「lime or water」を「lime and water」に訂正しました。

sen.j: 3種類の材料を混ぜ合わせることから「三和土」と書く。
sen.e: It is spelled 三和土" because three kinds of materials are mixed up for it.
It is written as 三和土" because three kinds of materials are mixed to create it.
It is written as "三和土" because three kinds of materials are mixed to create it.

sen.j: 「叩き土」とは花崗岩、安山岩などが風化して出来た土を言い、その土に石灰と水を加えて練ると硬化する性質がある。
sen.e: "Tatakitsuchi" refers to the clod made from weathered granite and andesite and characteristically solidifies by adding lime and water and kneading.
"Tatakitsuchi" refers to earth made from weathered granite and andesite and which is characteristically solidified by adding lime and water and kneading.
"Tatakitsuchi" refers to earth made from weathered granite and andesite and which is characteristically solidified by adding lime and water and kneading.

sen.j: 長崎の天川土、愛知県三河の三州土、京都深草の深草土などの叩き土に石灰や水を加えて練ったものを塗り叩き固め、一日二日おいた後に表面を水で洗い出して仕上げとする。
sen.e: Tataki is made by adding lime and water to beaten clods such as Tenkawa-zuchi (Tenkawa clod) in Nagasaki prefecture, Sanshu-zuchi (Sanshu clod) in Aichi prefecture and Fukakusa-zuchi (Fukakusa clod) in Kyoto prefecture, kneading and coating it on the floor, beating and solidifying and leaving it for one or two days and washing away the surface.

Tataki is made by adding lime and water to beaten earth such as Tenkawa-zuchi (Tenkawa earth) in Nagasaki prefecture, Sanshu-zuchi (Sanshu earth) in Aichi prefecture and Fukakusa-zuchi (Fukakusa earth) in Kyoto prefecture, kneading and coating it on the floor, beating and solidifying it, and then leaving it for one or two days before finally washing away the outer surface.

sen.j: もともとはセメントがなかった時代に、地面を固めるために使われたとされる。
sen.e: Originally, during the times when there were no cements, it was used to solidify the ground.
Before the advent of cement, it was originally used to solidify the ground.

sen.j: 現在では、コンクリート製やタイルを貼った土間なども三和土と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: At present, earthen floors coated with concrete or tiled are also called tataki.
In modern Japan earthen floors coated with concrete or tiles are also called tataki.
